meanings.definition: To bargain or negotiate over a price.
meanings.sent1: They decided to higgle over the cost of the used bicycle.
meanings.sent2: Customers often higgle with street vendors to get a better deal.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would higgle playfully over who got the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling market, the merchants higgled like seagulls fighting over a fish.
meanings.sent5: The image of the two friends higgling over the antique vase stuck in her mind.

meanings.sent1: The higgle between the children was quickly resolved by their teacher.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to get involved in their higgle about whose turn it was.
meanings.sent3: The higgle between the cats over the sunny spot on the couch was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The higgle between the birds over the last worm seemed like a serious matter to them.
meanings.sent5: The higgle between the squirrels over the acorn was a sight to behold in the park.
